intro: Racosperma pickardii, commonly known as the Pickard's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow floral spikes. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for native wildlife. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
